entry.title: Chaos;Child Drama CD - Wish
entry.content:
Chaos;Child Drama CD - Wish




Skipping to a slightly more serious Drama CD, the sixth from the DVD/BD releases.

This one revolves around Serika. Triggered by a conversation with Sakuma, Serika wonders about her true desires - a wish of her own.

Major spoilers for Chaos;Child. I advise not reading until after completing the true route. There are some slight hints to Fools as well, so you may wish to read that first.

You can view the translation here.

entry.title: Robotics;Notes DaSH Summary Document
entry.content:
Robotics;Notes DaSH Summary Document




The summary document includes the plot summary of all routes in Robotics;Notes DaSH, along with a route walkthrough.

Robotics;Notes DaSH continues on half a year after the events of Robotics;Notes. Having spent the previous months studying on the mainland, Kai returns to Tanegashima. On the same ferry rides a certain Super Hacker...

DaSH details the adventures of Daru and the returning Robotics;Notes cast. For the most part, the game is a fandisk and does not take itself too seriously. If you wish to skip such service, the reading order for the true route is provided.

You can view the document here.

- Minamisawa Senri

Chaos;Child Drama CD - The narrow path off the beaten track

Time to start up translating Chaos;Child content once more. Here for you today is the script of the Comiket 91 Drama CD.

The story revolves around the Newspaper Club trip to a traditional Japanese inn, complete with onsen. Various activities may or may not occur, depending on the delusion you desire.

You can view the translation here.

entry.title: Minikui Mojika no Ko - overview and lyrics

link.title: Minikui Mojika no Ko - overview and lyrics

entry.content:
Minikui Mojika no Ko - overview and lyrics

Minikui Mojika no Ko focuses on making you and the characters suffer. It is devoid of any light scenes, the sex scenes are bitter and glimmers of hope are quickly snuffed out.

A quick overview of the premise. The protagonist, Tanezaki Suteru, is the ugliest person in the world. Having gained a spot in one of the most prestigious schools in the country, he faces daily bullying from the rest of his class. However, he has a special ability/curse; when he gazes at the faces of others, he can read their hearts, with words materialising beside them - Mojika. After another bullied member of his class is forced to falsely confess their love for him, he decides to use his powers to escape and take revenge.

The majority of the game is spent with your gaze directed towards the ground; to objects lying on the floor and the feet of others. The art style focuses on realism and works well with the story themes. Choices are made through deciding when to look up and to use the power of the Mojika. The majority of the main routes are easy to navigate to, but the true route takes a bit more effort (fortunately, there are hints in the stub endings to guide you on your way).

If you enjoy reading stories which abuse your feelings, make you uncomfortable and have harsh endings, look no further.




I have translated the lyrics to the opening and ending songs.

Opening - 憐 (Pitiful)

Ending - 空 (Sky)

- Minamisawa Senri
